channel.title: I need help with this
channel.description:
Ok basically any open source client i download and try to edit after i edit them i get these stupid 100 errors. The thing is its on Every client? even if i compile it right after a download meaning i dont even edit some files. What could be wrong? Its really frustrating when you are trying to create a Multi Private Server Gaming team and i get these errors with the most simpleist things. I mean i can code a World of warcraft private server from scratch because i have been taught how and it becomes easy. But trying to code a Runescape server or client seems really really hard lol. Yeah i know thats funny. But if anyone helps me fix the errors ill give them mod rights to my server when we go live.
Compiler.bat [CODE] @echo off color 0c title Client Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac" *.java pause[/CODE]
Here are my errors.
[CODE]import sign.signlink; ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub3.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub4.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub5.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class46.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class34.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class35.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class36.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class37.java:2: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class38.java:2: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class4.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class41.java:2: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class50.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class8.java:1: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^ Class1.java:55: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class Class1 signlink.reporterror("91499, " + class30 + ", " + l + ", " + byte0 + ", " + runtimeexception.toString()); ^ Class12.java:60: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class Class12 signlink.reporterror("47547, " + class30_sub2 + ", " + l + ", " + by te0 + ", " + runtimeexception.toString()); ^ Class30_Sub2_Sub2.java:176: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class Class30_Sub2_Sub2 signlink.reporterror("14395, " + i + ", " + l + ", " + runtimeexcept ion.toString()); ^ client.java:266: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.midifade = 0; ^ client.java:267: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.midi = "stop"; ^ client.java:431: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) { ^ client.java:432: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.startthread(runnable, i); ^ client.java:442: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:443: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client return signlink.opensocket(i); ^ client.java:548: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.midifade = flag ? 1 : 0; ^ client.java:549: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.midisave(abyte0, abyte0.length); ^ client.java:724: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(aBoolean960 && signlink.cache_dat != null) ^ client.java:930: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client return signlink.wavereplay(); ^ client.java:1179: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror(aString1173 + " size mismatch in getnpcpos - po s:" + class30_sub2_sub2.anInt1406 + " psize:" + i); ^ client.java:1185: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror(aString1173 + " null entry in npc list - po s:" + i1 + " size:" + anInt836); ^ client.java:1660: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("18622, " + flag + ", " + l + ", " + runtimeexc eption.toString()); ^ client.java:1990: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("15283, " + byte0 + ", " + l + ", " + runtimeex ception.toString()); ^ client.java:2566: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.storeid = 32; ^ client.java:2567: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); ^ client.java:2602: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror(aString1173 + " glcfb " + aLong1215 + "," + j + "," + aBoolean960 + "," + aClass14Array970[0] + "," + aClass42_Sub1_1068.me thod552() + "," + anInt918 + "," + anInt1069 + "," + anInt1070); ^ client.java:2691: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:2692: package signlink does not exist return signlink.mainapp.getAppletContext(); ^ client.java:2885: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client return signlink.wavesave(abyte0, i); ^ client.java:3554: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(!signlink.reporterror) ^ client.java:3561: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(!signlink.reporterror) ^ client.java:3568: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(!signlink.reporterror) ^ client.java:4748: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror = false; ^ client.java:4905: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:4906: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client return signlink.mainapp; ^ client.java:5540: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client class9.aString248 = "You last logged in " + s + " from: " + sign link.dns; ^ client.java:5838: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:5839: package signlink does not exist return signlink.mainapp.getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); ^ client.java:5950: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.errorname = s; ^ client.java:5985: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402(signlink.uid); ^ client.java:6850: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.sunjava) ^ client.java:6860: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.cache_dat != null) ^ client.java:6863: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client aClass14Array970[i] = new Class14(0x7a120, signlink.cache_dat, s ignlink.cache_idx[i], i + 1, true); ^ client.java:6863: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client aClass14Array970[i] = new Class14(0x7a120, signlink.cache_dat, s ignlink.cache_idx[i], i + 1, true); ^
client.java:7264: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("loaderror " + aString1049 + " " + anInt1079); ^ client.java:7441: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:7442: package signlink does not exist return signlink.mainapp.getCodeBase(); ^ client.java:8547: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("cde2"); ^ client.java:8688: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("glfc_ex " + ((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (aClass3 0_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126)).anInt1550 + "," + ((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (aClass 30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126)).anInt1551 + "," + anInt1014 + "," + anInt1015 + ", " + anInt1069 + "," + anInt1070 + "," + anInt1034 + "," + anInt1035); ^ client.java:8754: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.wavevol = i; ^ client.java:8879: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("45688, " + l + ", " + i + ", " + runtimeexcept ion.toString()); ^ client.java:9257: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.reporterror("47229, " + i + ", " + l + ", " + runtimeexcept ion.toString()); ^ client.java:9264: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client if(signlink.mainapp != null) ^ client.java:9265: package signlink does not exist return signlink.mainapp.getParameter(s); ^ client.java:9276: cannot find symbol symbol : variable signlink location: class client signlink.midivol = i; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 100 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/CODE]
This is what my Runserver.bat looks like: [CODE] @ECHO OFF TITLE Client JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI PAUSE[/CODE]
This is the errors i get:
[CODE]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Press any key to continue . . .[/CODE]
Can Anyone help me please? im trying to create my own client and im begging to think its not the client files that are erroring.

item.title: I need help with this
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:15, topic:127779”]Your classpath variable is located in the wrong directory, so you can define it while running it:

javac -cp sign *.java

Or summat[/quote]
You’re also going to want the current directory in their (.).

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with this
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Your classpath variable is located in the wrong directory, so you can define it while running it:

javac -cp sign *.java

Or summat

Read full topic

item.description:
@grandtheft wrote:

No lol this is not about a freaking runescape private server! just cause clients allow you to log into a server doesnt mean thats there only point. I posted it on this forum because its Runescape “client” hacking tips. Anyways where would i get that? because when i try to compile soulscape i get the same 100 errors. and soulscape is a diffrent client.

item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

@ all you people directing him to moparisthebest.com.

He is not asking about private servers, yes you can decompile and take interest in the runescape private server client without having any interest in private servers.

item.title: I need help with this
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:6, topic:127779”]The class signlink in the folder sign is missing
package sign.signlink; means that it imports the file sign.signlink. Maby you forgot to compile that file? Or is it completly missing[/quote]

No, the package sign has not been declared or cannot be found due to Javac not wanting to search the sign folder.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with this
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

The class signlink in the folder sign is missing
package sign.signlink; means that it imports the file sign.signlink. Maby you forgot to compile that file? Or is it completly missing

Read full topic
